nodes.text: The guard shack door has a handle that implies consent. The call box does not.
A label plate beneath the speaker is sun-faded: SECV — REMOTE ATTENDANCE.
SECV remote attendance. (pause) You're on a recorded line—quality and yeah liability. (pause) Alright. (pause) What do you need (pause) so you stay safe (pause) and this doesn't land in my lap?
I can't pop the vestibule (pause) just because you asked. (pause) I need the system to show (pause) an authorized onsite presence first. (pause) Otherwise it's my name (pause) on the why.
I can't verify identity over the speaker. (pause) I can check the schedule for your name. (pause) That's all. (pause) It keeps the paper happy.
Yeah. (pause) You’re scheduled today under OLEA closeout. (pause) Activity. (pause) That’s your name in the system, anyway. (pause) Anything past that gets sticky for me.

Scheduled doesn't flip you to onsite. (pause)
Onsite is the box with a timestamp. (pause)
Something I can point to later. (pause)
Without it I'm not opening a door. (pause)
Then explaining how you got hurt. (pause)
With no record.

(ask) Confirm my schedule details. I need a trail.
(persuade) I’m OLEA. This is closure. You can rely on the work order.

nodes.text: I can't. (pause) If I unlock it on a call, (pause) the log tags me as authorization. (pause) I don't have clearance for that.
If there's a clean onsite record, sure. (pause) Right now it's just a voice. (pause) On a speaker. (pause) And for what it's worth you've been polite. (pause) Thanks.
Temporary Presence Receipt, or whatever it’s called now.

It needs your name and date. (pause) Activity type too. (pause) The site field must read 'onsite'. (pause) Not 'expected'. (pause) Once it's in the file, (pause) I can hit the vestibule door. (pause) No making you up in the log.

Used to be you walked there. (pause) To the Records window. (pause) Now it’s: find whoever has Records authority. (pause) Or find the stamp. (pause) Or follow pneumatic tube instructions. (pause) They act like Records still has staff. (pause) I’m not joking. (pause) That’s the procedure.

choices.text: (ask) So: get marked onsite. Then call you.

nodes.text: Yeah. (pause) Get the onsite mark, then call me. (pause) I can't move a door without paper. (pause) It says you're here.

What I’m seeing: Field Systems Specialist, OLEA. (pause) Closure verification. (pause) Staged shutdown prep. (pause) Today through end-of-day. (pause) Tagged “subject to onsite confirmation.” (pause) That tag is the only reason. (pause) I can even say this much.

I can't read personal schedule details. (pause) Not to an unverified caller. (pause) Get a Presence Receipt from Records marked onsite. (pause) I can attach it to that event. (pause) Then it's treated as ops.

I'm looking at the work order. (pause) It tells me you're scheduled. (pause) Over this speaker I can't act. (pause) It doesn't give me anything usable. (pause) I need Records to tag you onsite. (pause) Then the work order has somewhere to land.
Once Records flips you to onsite (pause) I can do doors and cameras (pause) and timed unlocks. (pause) Until then (pause) I'm stuck on the phone (pause) and I'm about out of bandwidth.

choices.text: (ask) Then my task is to get marked onsite.

nodes.text: You have your next step: get marked onsite by Records— because the facility only recognizes people once it can file them.
Alright. (pause) Call back once you're marked onsite. (pause) I get it. (pause) You can't do that from where you are. (pause) Stay safe.
The speaker pops. A breath. Then a voice that sounds like it’s already composing an email about this.

External Assurance line three—no, sorry. (pause) The box still labels it “Guard.” (pause) Go ahead. (pause) State your purpose in a sentence. (pause) Two if you must. (pause) It helps with comparability.

choices.text: Ask: “I need access to the shack.”
Persuade: “I’m OLEA. Give me the actual access path.”
Ask: “Confirm for the record: locked door, reader can log but not actuate.”

nodes.text:
Access isn't one action. (pause) It's chain of custody. (pause)
If you mean entry, (pause) it's governed by the site's mothball status. (pause)
That's operational posture. (pause) Not abandonment.

So the correct first step is (pause) confirm access control can log a record. (pause) Try your badge. (pause) If it fails, don’t repeat more than twice. (pause) Repetition implies expectation. (pause) Expectation implies a test. (pause) Tests imply scope.
The speaker waits with the patience of a form.
Underpowered is a strong word.(pause) I'd say “intermittently energized.”(pause) Consistent with mothball.(pause) Mothball isn't off.(pause) It's minimized.
It may authenticate without actuating, yes. (pause) That’s actually preferable for us. (pause) Authentication creates a timestamp. (pause) Actuation creates liability.
Static crackles, like someone shuffling papers.

“On-site” is geographic. (pause)
“Present” is procedural. (pause)
No staffed guard function. (pause)
If that’s what you’re asking. (pause)
Staffing was removed under the continuity amendment. (pause)
Because the facility was considered stable.

Stable as in “not moving.” (pause) Not stable as in “safe.” (pause) Different column. (pause)
Assurance is remote. (pause) Contracted by your funders, not your office. (pause) So we don’t muddle authority. (pause)
I document deviations. (pause) I don’t authorize solutions.
The call box hums, faintly pleased to be useful.

I hear you, (pause) I’m not disputing your badge color. (pause) But “actual access path” implies one sanctioned route. (pause) If I say it aloud it’s discoverable. (pause) So I can confirm what’s not available. (pause) For your record.

There is no on-site attendant. (pause) There is no remote door release. (pause) The reader is budgeted to log attempts. (pause) Not to drive the strike. (pause) So it’s “intermittently energized.” (pause) If you need entry, use another mechanism. (pause) Not the reader.

Like a work order. (pause) Like a keyed override. (pause) It may or may not exist. (pause) Where the signage claims it exists. (pause) Like—my personal favorite—routing your need. (pause) Through the pneumatic system, because then it (pause) becomes paper. (pause) And everyone relaxes.
The speaker clicks softly, as if it’s smiling.
I can’t validate authority from a call box. (pause) Want this to be actionable? (pause) Phrase it as an observation I can log. (pause) Not an instruction I can transmit.

Confirmed as stated: door state is locked. (pause) The reader’s power posture supports logging attempts. (pause) Reliable actuation is not supported. (pause) This boundary is acceptable for outside documentation.
The line disconnects cleanly. You’re left with the door, the weak light, and a conversation that will outlive you in a folder.
